column4: {Order Stuck} | [Untuckit] Order stuck in routing
P2 **Weird workflow** [Roots] Cancelled order items got shipped
column35:
Some of the order items from orders placed during the AWS Outage window on 20 November ended-up being cancelled on NewStore side (and thus refunded to the customer), while simultaneously already being fulfilled from DCs. This resulted in those affected (and refunded!) items being ultimately delivered to the customers.

We found out that this cancellation was caused by an automatic cancellation logic inside `logistic_order` service. 

As a result, we improved some of our internal state handling (especially how we handle `logistic_order.dispatched`). This fix better handles cancelling of such order items, and thus ultimately also prevents triggering the unwanted refund. 

@Flo nicely covers the technicalities here:
[https://gitlab.com/newstore/engineering/routing/services/logistic_order/-/commit/e7bd3259b2091becb781d3b8fb5fb9f81cc73d46|https://gitlab.com/newstore/engineering/routing/services/logistic_order/-/commit/e7bd3259b2091becb781d3b8fb5fb9f81cc73d46]

And here’s the fix MR:
[https://gitlab.com/newstore/engineering/routing/services/logistic_order/-/commit/96f287cd480bbbbd549bd4dc06c4ee3bd43239fd|https://gitlab.com/newstore/engineering/routing/services/logistic_order/-/commit/96f287cd480bbbbd549bd4dc06c4ee3bd43239fd|smart-link]

column4: [Reebok]Error when Transferring Inv. from Store to Store (Reebok-Sandbox)
column35:
We have found out that the stores reported did not have `shipping_address` set, only `physical_address` existed. We improved the Associate App UX as part of this, as well as communicated the need to have the `shipping_address` set through a separate API call.

Furthermore we have improved the backend logic to default to `physical_address` if `shipping_address` doesn't exist, so this issue has been solved/solutions communicated through several ways, and thus was deemed OK to be closed.

column4: [jewells] Can't refund (appeasement) items fully on certain order
column35:
There was a bug (in both Sales order 1.0 and 2.0) implementations of Number type checks in client-side javascript. 

It's the archetypical floating point arithmetic issue (e.g. 0.1+0.2 !== 0.3) that seems to have made it's way into production code. 

We fixed the issue in both Sales order 1.0 and 2.0 (with an accompanying unit test).

column4: Image not appearing after import for the product
[Jewells] Request to default residential flag for Royal Mail v3 in EasyPost adapter and allow reroute fallback
column35:
The issue lies with shipments between Northern Ireland and the UK when booked with Royal Mail V3. It requires a UKIMS number and/or the delivery to be flagged with `residential=true` flag when calling EasyPost API. 

Right now the best interim solution found was to attempt these deliveries using DHL which will handle customs appropriately. In the future cases like this may warrant a need give the retailer some additional UI/control over which orders need `residential=true` flag set, as right now there isn't a way to control this from NewStore NOM platform.

column4: **Weird workflow**  [lornajane]Unusual order flow
[cosbar] orders going on hold because of missing phone number in shipping options to book delivery
column35:
There turned out to be a separate (duplicated) data mapping logic in Delivery v1 that contained the identical bug to one we solved in THQ-1340 a while back.

This other mapper gets invoked as part of Shipping Offer updates (as opposed to creation).

As part of this we created two PRs:
- Fixed the bug above in Delivery v1 https://gitlab.com/newstore/engineering/delivery/services/delivery/-/merge_requests/410

- Additionally made Delivery v2 always default the phone number to empty string if it’s not passed by the caller. This should not happen anymore, but we will do this to be 110% safe this problem doesn’t happen again for whatever other unforeseen reason. https://gitlab.com/newstore/engineering/delivery/services/delivery-v2/-/merge_requests/125

Latter also fixes another unreported bug which we found as part of today’s investigation!

column4: [Ganni] - 6 hour delay between In-Store order capture and initial Auth
column35:
Database proxy mechanism did it's job. It is expected to have a database failover recovery in couple of minutes with the current design. It is either this or full Sev1 (see recent FinOps incident). 
Alerts exist, but were not visible due to the high amount of noise we got from having all previously silenced alerts become visible. We are almost done with fixing this. The alerting became a problem after some changes done by platform and devex. We are on top of it. 

Plans to improve this are mentioned in the comment - we will move from minutes to seconds.

One last product reported later turned out to have been imported with `show_in_listing` flag as false. All explained in the comments section below.

column4: [offwhite] - Events not send on historical orders
column35:
It seemed that a large number of reported orders were stuck in routing (thus why the public event was not sent - the orders were not considered completed, even though they should have).

A runbook was written to resolve this once/if this happens in the future: https://goodscloud.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/HQ/pages/5627445249/Resolve+stuck+orders+during+Historical+Order+Import

Marking Chance of Reocurrence" as high due to underlying root not being clear. Will need to keep monitoring if this happens again."

column4: [vbretail] Products Missing from Catalog after Import (Veronica Beard)
column35:
We identified a technical issue in Catalog Indexer codebase, affecting how catalog data was processed during imports and how it subsequently got put into OpenSearch (leading to errors during indexing).

We’ve resolved the immediate cause of the issue by cleaning up some outdated references that were no longer needed. After that, we reprocessed the affected catalogs.

Refer to https://goodscloud.atlassian.net/browse/THQ-2048 for more detail on the inner workings of this.

column4: Catalog not working as expected
column35:
The issue was unexpected (and insufficiently documented) behaviour of our system, requiring a `default` pricebook to exist.

We got the customer's issue resolved through direct comms. And to prevent future occurrences we extended our documentation to make this requirement/constraint very explicit:
https://docs.newstore.com/docs/importing-data#why-is-the-default-pricebook-critical

column4: [GOC Retail/Leays] sales receipt, exchange, returns, and gift template produces excessive blank space
column35:
Resolved by retailer. 

Adding an extract directly from the original ticket - as hints:

”The original boilerplate had size: 80mm $$height$$ but this gives us the long blank space. After research I dont think this is a valid CSS code value. It is ignored and I assume the CSS default to auto for the height. As per Order LS000003671 (below). I replaced the items from being listed and you can see as per order LS000003672 where it improved the legth of the blank space after the footer but there is still some. What points to the blanks space being related to the CSS and height is when we set the CSS to width:80mm; alone. The result is no space below the footer, how it should be and you can see it’s defaulted to fixed pages and we get the double lines after 2 items, 9 items and for the final item and footer.

Hoping we can be given with a suggestion on how we should define the CSS. I am sure Leays is not the only customer using Newstore and the ribbon paper approach to printing receipts. How have other customers succeeded in this area we are having an issue?”

Adding snap from the conversation with ES. The confirmed similar.

!Screenshot 2025-08-08 at 10.43.54 (72f5044a-6ed2-4471-ac29-a72a5abc9633).png|width=718,height=277,alt=Screenshot 2025-08-08 at 10.43.54.png"!"

column4: [Cosbar-staging] Unable to get shipping offers during associate app add delivery, phoneNumber: none is not an allowed value
column35:
EasyPost (and specifically their downstream Fedex API dependency) have changed one of their request payload fields (`from_address`->`phone`) which were previously optional to become mandatory.

It turns out Delivery V1 passes address information to Delivery V2 which then passes it onto EasyPost Adapter.

Neither Delivery V1 nor Delivery V2 were correctly passing the the `phone` field when getting shipping options. Up until now this was not a problem, but since the field became mandatory it started to become an issue with FedEx.

We made sure the `phone` field is passed on both in Delivery V1 and Delivery V2 codebases which solved the problem downstream. Customer confirmed the fix worked.

column4: [Untuckit] Offline orders not created in NOM
column35:
The customer raised a question about offline orders not being visible in NOM. After a thorough investigation on our end we concluded that we cannot see these orders ever being injected into HQ domain to begin with. We did some more digging and found that likely these orders would go through Adyen Terminal -> Team FinOps -> Team Selling -> ... before reaching Team HQ, so we suggested checking in with those prior teams whether they can see those orders reaching NewStore.

Eventually (after communicating above findings) we have not heard back from the customer for a whole working week and had to close the THQ ticket due to inactivity.

column4: [Frame] Orders failed to book shipment and yet transitioned to printing
column35:
We've observed that the issue of orders becoming stuck follows a consistent pattern: orders are first placed on hold, and then the exception handler process was used to manually route the order to a specific location. 

Upon reviewing historical context around the Route To Specific Location feature, I found that the exception handler was originally intended as an override mechanism. It allows routing to proceed despite delivery failures or insufficient stock, essentially ignoring such validation errors.

Given this, It might be good to revisit this functionality. In particular, we should consider whether:

* Failures could be made visible to the user (rather than silently ignored), and/or
* The exception handler process could be safely re-triggered if needed.

I've created a [ticket|https://goodscloud.atlassian.net/browse/THQ-1238] to initiate this review

column4: [JamesAvery-sandbox] Historical refund processed to Adyen
column35:
After a thorough investigation and communicating to all parties involved (including conversations with Payments team, Team Checkout, and responsible Solutions Architect), we've come to conclusion that the only way this has worked in the past is if back in 2022 another version of Returns API was used (there are two versions live currently). Both of those versions are owned by Team Checkout, so if customer/integration partners feel they want changes made in those, we would need to re-assign the work.

Overall we've provided a path forward for the customer and outlined all of our investigation which we hope will aid in setting up the historical imports.

column4: [funko-staging] get order details api by order type is returning different product attributes
column35:
In Python, 0 evaluates to False, which means when price_catalog is 0, the field is omitted from the JSON output.

The fix introdued makes sure that when price_catalog value is 0.0, implementation correctly includes it in the resulting payload. This has likely been an issue that fell through the cracks at the time.

It can be seen from the earlier logic in the code that there was a desire to default to 0.0 (even if Catalog API returns None value), but it was later lost due a bug in conditional logic.

Public API Endpoint affected:
https://docs.newstore.net/api/integration/order-management/sales_order_api/

column4: [vbretail-staging]Packing slip using wrong locale template
column35:
The customer had questions about how locales are handled in documents like `packing_slip`. We've done the investigation and communicated the business behaviours.

For internal use, and to solve such questions more efficiently in the future there's now also an informational runbook available:
https://goodscloud.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/HQ/pages/5523636245/How+locale+handling+works+in+Store+Fulfillment+documents

column4: Carton Scan not working as expected.
Error on checkout with custom shipping
[Veja] - Sizes Display Order [all environment] EU Sizes
[clarks] - Error on shipping offer - Future launch for Clarks impacted
column35:
From our initial investigation, this particular logistic order state (SHIPPING_OFFER_UPDATE_ERROR) can be reached by a transient error - like an external system not being available - or an issue with the shipping address.

It was deemed to be caused by a transient error, the retailer was able to perform a retry in NOM and it solved the problem.

The original problem observed by the retailer had been an intermittent issues with the 3rd party intergation.

column4: return_label_url validation
column35:
Speaking with Florent, Meriam, Evgheni - it seems like:
* there is validation, if stores have return label documents configured then the shipping adapters must return a valid response with a valid URL in the return_label_url field 
* spec is clear about the requirement for this field for return shipments 
* they must have changed something on their end that made the adapter not compliant because i don’t see any request for return shipments


Therefore most likely something done by the retailer. Good they fixed it on their own.

Unfortunately this is not available in the system as it is today. Until we have an API that can soft-delete such cases we should really stay away from any database change.

*+Suggestion from Brandon:+*
Also, another quick win would be to explicitly call out that we cannot modify Fulfillment locations in our Documentation.  
As I explained to the retailer: “ I would highly suggest that this is carefully planned and executed when performed on a Production environment.”
